attributes.action: Force water suppliers to remove water meters and create a fair banding charge.
attributes.background: Water meters have created a heavy burden on poorer families as bills have risen more than double since their introduction. There are many families who are hundreds of pounds in debt to the water companies and are being chased by debt companies. Water is a human right to have not a luxury.

attributes.action: Stop women who have a third child as a result of rape to have to declare it.
attributes.background:
Guardian 16.3.17 proposal to ask new mothers who have been raped for verification if they wish to claim tax credits for more than two children has become law without any debate/vote in parliament.

The so-called rape clause, was added to legislation late on Wed as an amendment to an existing act.
attributes.additional_details:
controversial proposal to ask new mothers who have been raped for verification if they wish to claim tax credits for more than two children has become law without any debate or vote in parliament.

The so-called rape clause, which will be applied as part of new restrictions on tax credit entitlement, was added to legislation late on Wednesday as an amendment to an existing act. The plans will come into effect within a month. It will.mean someone may need to relive sexual assault.

attributes.action: Get Scotland its independence without a referendum
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has blocked any referendum for the people of Scotland.  Since when did the PM know what the Scottish people want.  She clearly does not.
attributes.additional_details: We the Scottish people have been lied to by Westminster.  Westminster lied to us about our oil running out.  We are being dragged out of the EU against our will.  Scotland was told it would have new powers and still nothing.  We the Scottish people want our Independence.

attributes.action: Call a UK wide referendum on Scottish independence by the end of 2018.
attributes.background: I believe more people in England would like Scotland to become an independent nation than those in Scotland itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year Scotland spends more than its entire GDP, this overspend is covered by the rest of the UK, by making Scotland leave the UK the rest of the UK will gain billions of pounds which could be spent more wisely.

attributes.action: Make all naturally medicinal drugs legal: Cannabis, Magic Mushrooms & DMT.
attributes.background: First of all, the human experience is a living drug, our emotions & feelings are made up of chemicals and drugs in our brain. Naturally occurring drugs are there to help us heal ourselves and to reconnect with nature. Why allow man-made smoking but forbid what has grown on earth naturally for us?
attributes.additional_details: Even though there are risks to these drugs, they are a lot safer than Alcohol & Cigerettes. Imagine cutting down trees because people may fall out of them? Thats the current logic as to why they are illegal. You cant be fully safe with anything but you can be INFORMED. Once these are decriminalised they should make it okay for us to grow them ourselves or for us to be able to go down the road and pop into a cafe with an age restriction, add tax to the price so then money is being put to good use

attributes.action: Review what constitutes a conflict of interests for MPs with second jobs.
attributes.background: Public confidence in politicians is threatened by MPs taking second jobs, especially where a clear conflict of interests exists, such as editing a newspaper. How can a serving MP adequately and objectively represent their constituents while they have a commitment to other work? We need clarity.
attributes.additional_details: Recently two MPs resigned to take up other work: Tristram Hunt to become director of the Victoria and Albert Museum; and Jamie Reed to take up a post at Sellafield. With the news that George Osborne, serving MP for Tatton, has become editor of the Evening Standard yet has not resigned, the public needs clarity on which sectors outside parliament, if any, it is acceptable for serving MPs to work in, and what creates a conflict of interest between MPs' work for constituents and another employer?

attributes.action: Use Road Equivalent Tariff (as used for Scottish Ferry fares) for Rail Fares.
attributes.background: It is cheaper for two people to travel in their own car rather than by train on some journeys. Rail fares should be cheaper than taking a car, encouraging less car use.
attributes.additional_details:
Typical journey Forres to Aberdeen 78 miles  

single rail fare for couple (2 at £23.20) = £46.40

typical total cost by car (ref AA) 78miles at £0.40 = £31.20

attributes.action: At least 75% of the population need to vote for change in a referendum
attributes.background: Refrendums have been very devisive and it seems ludicrous  that it can be decided by a single vote either way. If 75% of the population don't vote for change then the status quo should be upheld. It has led to the nation being split  following the Brexit vote and Scottish Indy vote 1, 2 or more.

attributes.action: By-elections enforced for breaking election expenses rules
attributes.background: To enforce a Parliamentary by-election where the existing winning candidate breaks election expenses rules. Also to include additional fines and possible banning of that Party from standing in that by-election.
attributes.additional_details:
With the Conservative Party being fined £70,000 for recent breaches, as well as others, it is clear that free and fair elections are no more than a myth and that such actions undermine the democratic process.

This petition demands that breaches of electoral expenses by the winning candidate will require an immediate by-election, the possibility of fines amounting to several times the value of the breach and the banning of the Party in breach from standing in that by-election.

attributes.action: Remove the lower limit on the nil band Class 4 National Insurance contributions.
attributes.background: This is a separate matter to the Spring 2017 budget. From 2018 those earning < £5,965 must pay £733 p.a. (£14.10/w) for National Security via Class 3 National Insurance Contributions (NICs) while, unfairly, those earning more (£5,965-£8,060) will pay £0 to access them via a nil band on Class 4 NICs.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Ref: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/consultation-on-abolishing-class-2-national-insurance-and-introducing-a-contributory-benefit-test-to-class-4-national-insurance-for-the-self-employed/the-abolition-of-class-2-national-insurance-introducing-a-benefit-test-into-class-4-national-insurance-for-the-self-employed, accessed 16th March 2017.

2. Ref: https://www.aat.org.uk/prod/s3fs-public/assets/AAT_response_toConsultationonClass2NICabolition2016.pdf, accessed 16th March 2017.

attributes.action: Review Used Car Warranty Policies, they refuse claims unfairly and never pay out
attributes.background: These warranty claims companies offer mostly 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 star policies, the cost of the policy and coverage depends on the level of cover you purchase, whenever a claim is made, there first reply is " that's not covered " In most cases they refuse as it's wear and tear, well its a used car !!.
attributes.additional_details: History of used car warranties the injectors failed, the EGR valve failed, brake callipers have seized, the brake discs failed, the gear box was slipping and needed transmission fluid change and trani doctor added to fix it, this should have been a gearbox change, but they said it's a service issue or it's wear and tear so not covered, DPF failed, not covered, these warranties don't cover attempting to find the problem, they won't pay for trying to find the fault, these warranties are a scandal

attributes.action: As we can't agree what we voted for in the EURef redo it with better question.
attributes.background: 'Leave the EU' was the question, but Ll the answers seem to be very different. It was too vague a question and the ambiguity is causing too much pain to ALL. Let's do it again with a better question and 16+ vote.

attributes.action: Allow UK citizens to volunteer for Jury service.
attributes.background: Having completed jury service I'm surprised that you cannot volunteer.  I have shared my experience with friends/colleagues and the overriding response is 'I would love to do Jury service'.  During my jury service I saw others who had been summoned drop out meaning the whole case was abandoned.
attributes.additional_details: The volunteer scheme would involve people being able to let the Court Service know they are interested and available to take part in this interesting and important civic duty.  It could be run in addition to the summons scheme.  This would allow UK citizens who want to commit to Jury service let the Court service, who need jurors, know they are interested.

attributes.action: Say no to school bags!
attributes.background: This petition is about making school bags optional,children lose interest in coming to school with the stress of carrying heavy bags. Carrying very heavy school bags can lead to musculoskeletal problems.
attributes.additional_details: School bags are too heavy for students, the solution to this problem is to every school being provided with lockers that are free or having e-books/Ipads.

attributes.action: Greater approbation of open dialogue in mental health context.
attributes.background: Open dialogue restores mental health more effectively than with conventional psychiatric drugs.  Originating in Finland in the 80's it has a proven track record of curing70% of their clients with little or no drugs fewer relapses no need for hospital beds , no expensive bill for medication.

attributes.action: Give all Public Sector Workers the same pay raises across the board.
attributes.background: All Public Servants, regardless of whether they are a firefighter, NHS, Police, MOD et al they should all receive the same increases. Therefore no one group should be given a raise greater than another group. Therefore the MPs getting 10%, the same should be given to all within the Public Sector.

attributes.action: Need more consumer protection for airline & travel bookings.
attributes.background: People spend thousands of pounds buying air tickets & making travel bookings. Strangely there is no consumer protection whatsoever. There must a period of atleast 14 days when the consumer has the ability to cancel their purchase and get a full refund in line with distance selling regulations.
attributes.additional_details: The vast majority of the airline tickets are 100% non refundable which means the consumer has no recourse to change their mind. Given that most people book several months in advance, there is a high likelyhood of changes to travel plans. The current system is so heavily against the consumer & is is inherently unfair. Why should airlines and travel companies enjoy such unprecented priveleges? I call upon the government to legistate for better rights to consumers in this regard.

attributes.action: Deny Turkish government-sponsored rallies in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Follow the governments of Germany and the Netherlands in denying access to members of the Turkish government from addressing Turkish expat communities across Europe.

attributes.action: Pay Child Maintenance To Single Parents Only
attributes.background: Child Maintenance should be paid ONLY to single parents as when they start another relationship or get married, their income increases.
attributes.additional_details: The paying parent has new relationship children taken into account on their earnings, so why shouldn't the receiving parents partner's income be also taken into account as they are now supporting the children.

attributes.action: Close down schools that breach the Equality Act.
attributes.background: There are schools that teach homophobia, sexism and racism under the guise of 'religion'. This is indoctrination and harassment, directly in breach of the Equality Act. It creates a hostile environment for children and attacks protected characteristics. This is breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/editorials/illegal-faith-schools-education-ofted-a7587621.html
Any school that is breaking the Equality Act is an 'illegal school'. All schools need to be rigorously inspected. Downgrading them is not enough. They need to change or be closed. They are breaking the law.
http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/12/21/christian-schools-downgraded-by-ofsted-over-homophobic-teachings/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for insurance companies to ask about non fault incidences/claims
attributes.background: Insurance premiums are sky high already. It is totally unfair that insurance companies ask about these incidences and charge higher perimiums as a result. They already charge the driver who was at fault a higher premium, why do they also need to penalise the driver who was innocent! This is unfair
attributes.additional_details: These incidents have to be declared for 5yrs! A non fault accident can cause higher premiums for driver for 5 whole years! My insurance was £1400 this year with a £1350 excess because of 3 non faults in the last 5 years with a 5yr ncb. It looks set to remain this high for 5years, maybe even go up next year. It would have been £700 otherwise. People are reduced to not reporting things and sorting it out themselves. Or worse, forced off the road. They have us over a barrel and abuse this power.

attributes.action: Make spice a class A drug
attributes.background: We all need to come together and stop this. The nhs is under enough pressure as it. So please sign this and lets make the world a better place to live.
attributes.additional_details: I'm starting a petition about spice and illegal highs, now at one time they was legal, now they are not legal. I have noticed an increase of homeless people in Manchester City centre, smoking spice and not knowing what to do afterwards. The worst case can cause death.  Now I'm no drug expert, but these drugs should not be allowed on our streets. Especially where elderly people, kids really all types of different lifestyles & all ages are. So please help my petition come into action.

attributes.action: Repeal the fixed term parliament act, hold elections, reform the House of Lords
attributes.background: The HOL reform has been promised for years and needs to be acted upon not sidelined, especially when those with vested interests in institutions such as the EU are not debarred from casting votes.

attributes.action: Provide funding to food banks to help supply appropriate food to ethnic groups
attributes.background: There is currently a regional situation whereby food bank charities would not supply appropriate food to multiple different ethnic groups’ requirements, such as Halal. This needs the government's backing as the health of this country's community, can not be left as the responsibility of charities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for bank and building societies to allow gambling on credit card
attributes.background: I think it should be illegal to gamble on credit cards as it allows vulnerable people to easily get into debt with money that they should have never been allowed to gamble with. People with the addiction can easily use the full amount of credit chasing the previous bet they lost. Puts lives at risk
attributes.additional_details: Please support this, many people need your help. Not only gambling money they can't afford but hiding the truth from people who truly care about them. Making them feel depressed and not knowing where they can turn.

attributes.action: Do not deport Commonwealth Soldiers who served in The British Army Reserve.
attributes.background: Please allow Foreign & Commonwealth Soldiers the automatic right to remain in the UK after four years of service. Don't sanction them to make an application within 28 days to the Home Office or they face deportation, this is an act of injustice.
attributes.additional_details: We fight for Queen & Country so we deserve better.

attributes.action: Repeal the Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011
attributes.background: The Fixed Term Parliaments Act should be repealed immediately to allow an opportunity to call a snap election. With several obstacles on the horizon for the government, a general election will most likely strengthen its hand and reaffirm the voters support and representation.

attributes.action: Put the risks of having a cot bumper in the SIDS guidelines.
attributes.background: There is many stories out there that cot bumpers are unsafe and can cause death e.g suffocation and strangulation. If this were in the SIDS guidelines parents are made aware of the risks before and after there baby is born.
attributes.additional_details: Prestons Story

attributes.action: Remove home address from driving licences.
attributes.background: Driving Licences are numbered so all information can be found by bodies who need to do so.  Carrying your address around with you is not secure.

attributes.action: Stop taxpayers money from being spent on translators and interpreters in the UK
attributes.background: It's nothing new that millions of pounds of taxpayers money is spent each year for migrants who don't speak English. The huge sum of money is spent in hospitals and courts among other places on translators and interpreters for migrants who come to the UK and don't speak English.

attributes.action: Make it that only UK elected officials can vote on legislation before Parliament
attributes.background: When The House of Commons, comprising of publicly elected MPs, debate, and vote in favour of any legislation, The House of Lords, which is a totally unelected body, should not be able to reject, amend, or interfere with said legislation, in any way, other than in an advisory capacity.

attributes.action: School Admissions: Get your child into a school of your choice.
attributes.additional_details:
Two in five local councils have do not have enough school places meaning that there are an increasing number of children not getting into schools of their choice. 

This pressure on the shortage of school places is contributing to larger class sizes and children having to travel further to attend school. 

This petition is a call for unified planning, by the government, to ensure there are enough different types of schools and most importantly school places for our children.

attributes.action: Make father's who have DNA test automatically on birth certificate
attributes.background: Some mothers are scared if they put the father's on birth certificates then they have less rights but no matter what for the benefit of that child both parents should be on the birth certificate and father's should still need to prove their parenting via contact centres etc
attributes.additional_details: I have seen to many devoted fathers with no rights whatsoever it isn't fair in this day and age, we all have the right to be equal and every child deserves to know who brought them into this world, this is the only flaw in our system in this situation we all have a point to prove ourselves and thats what contact centres are in place for worried parents of their ex partners for different reasons and background checks go into parents for to see who these people are

attributes.action: UK Government to encourage President Trump to visit Birmingham
attributes.background: Donald Trump defied all of the odds and is now the president for the United States. Unlike London, Birmingham voted to leave and played a huge part in the Brexit vote. Donald will save us from Brexit thanks to his trade deals.Leave means leave and Trump mean Trump. Lets MAKE BIRMINGHAM GREAT AGAIN!
attributes.additional_details: Birmingham is the second biggest city and one of the most diverse.

attributes.action: Turn smoking on hospital grounds into a criminal offence.
attributes.background: All hospitals in Engalnd are supposed to be smoke free, however there are no enforceable penalties for breaching this request. By criminalising this act, the cases if smoking on hospital grounds will reduce, which will benefit ill or recovering patients.

attributes.action: DNA testing dogs to trace owners whose dogs defecate in public areas.
attributes.background: Dog fouling so called is an act that many many people are incensed about and occurs because owners will not take responsibility for it. Playing fields, sports fields, pavements,  bear the brunt of the sheer unpleasantness of this avoidable form of litter, which after all, is a crime.

attributes.action: All new cars sold in Britain must have a phone kits installed.
attributes.background: Using mobile phones while driving is seriously dangerous and damages lives. Why can’t the government put in a simply law in place, to make all car manufactures install phone kits in to any new sold car. This could possibly save a lot of lives and save even more injuries.

attributes.action: Bring back 10 boxes of fags
attributes.background: I want the government to remove the law that states 10 boxes of fags and menthols carnt be sold

attributes.action: Start a television awareness campaign aimed at children about dangers and safety
attributes.background: Tv ads in the 80's made children aware for stranger danger and general health and safety..this is absent in today's society and needs re- addressing for adults and children

attributes.action: Invite the king of Holland to a state visit.
attributes.background: The people of Holland have a lot in common with the people of the UK. They speak English as standard. And I think it would unify us as a great leading trade partner.

attributes.action: calling for a law to place a cap on rent increases on Public Houses and Venues
attributes.background: Companies that lease out or rent Public Houses and venues keep raising the rent to extortionate levels to push out publicans who pour Their life, blood and sweat into keeping these places open but the rent keeps increasing. and this needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: I have seen so may Pubs close due to huge rent increases that cripple publicans and force them to close the doors after years sometimes even Decades of trading all because a company decides that the rent should increased in some cases doubled to levels that are un-achievable in the current economic climate. I ask that a cap be put on these rent increases to enable publicans to keep the doors open.

attributes.action: Delay British Summer Time by 1 day in 2017
attributes.background: British Summer Time starts on Mothering Sunday in 2017 meaning that the poor hardworking mothers of the UK lose an hour of their special day. This is so wrong and a smack in the face for all mothers.

attributes.action: Abolish Business Rates - Make The Difference in VAT to make UK more competitive.
attributes.background: From high-street retailers to SMEs attempting to grow, Business Rates are a burden that can only be overcome by charging more, making them less attractive compared to online retailers and imports. These rates have no bearing on the revenue of a business, and absolutely nothing is provided in return.
attributes.additional_details:
Moving business rates to VAT will level the playing field for SME's, rather than penalize UK firms for being in the UK. Often mistakenly compared to council tax, business rates are archaic and do not include refuse collection or any other service, and takes precedence over any other bill - it is deemed a statutory debt without any compromise that can lead to businesses filing for bankruptcy.
https://www.retail-week.com/topics/5049347.article
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3123850

attributes.action: That the government suspends Foreign Aid for 3 years to fund social care
attributes.background: Approx £12bn was spent in foreign aid in 2015. The biggest recipient Pakistan has nuclear weapons! This cash could be used to fund a social care program that cares for the elderly, disabled and those with mental health issues. Bed blocking costs the NHS approx £900m a year.
attributes.additional_details: Patients cannot be discharged because they are unable to cope at home alone without care.This puts huge pressure on the NHS and puts seriously ill patients at risk. Budgets in elderley, disabled and mental health care are being continually cut thereby forcing people back into the NHS system. The problem will continue to get worse as the population lives longer and budgets are squeezed even harder. This cash could be used to create a sustainable social care plan to address these issues

attributes.action: Stop our Government sending financial aid to China, India and Mexico.
attributes.background: This Petition is asking the Government to re-think the idea of sending financial aid to China, Mexico and India.
attributes.additional_details:
It has been widely reported in the media that our Government is planning to spend £1.3 billion UK tax payers' money on the improvement of social care for the elderly of China, India and Mexico.  
This Government and others have eroded our Military, we have thousands of people living on the streets, our NHS is in severe crisis, our schools are over populated and our own elderly live in fear of significantly high heating bills. This is so wrong! I would ask that the Government looks after the citizens of the UK who are in need and let other countries look after their social care.

attributes.action: Make transgender people be able to use the bathroom they feel comfortable with.
attributes.background: its wrong that people feel like they are forced to enter bathrooms that they do not feel comfortable with. This makes them stressed out and can increase their dysphoria. It shouldnt be right to stop people from being comfortable with themselves

attributes.action: Make employers pay a minimum of 6 Month full maternity pay to employees.
attributes.background: It should be compulsory for companies to pay an employee that has been with a company for at least a year their full monthly wage. Too many companies are not offering any benefits to new mothers putting the burden on the government system to pay this amount.
attributes.additional_details: It is impossible for a woman to live on an average of £112 weekly from the government, with rent or mortgage, bills, food shopping and a new baby to take care off its questionable as to how she would survive without going back to work almost immediately after giving birth or alternatively having to quit work to receive far better benefits from the government this would certainly put more pressure on the government  but If full pay for 6 was made compulsory it would save on government resources.

attributes.action: Ban the Operation of one person operated Trains (I.e. without a Guard/Conductor)
attributes.background:
There is currently a dispute between railway unions and operators over the proposal to operate trains single manned (without a guard/conductor)
This practice is not safe for the public, if a fight or assault happens there is no one to call on, likewise if there is a problem when departing a station
attributes.additional_details:
Trains have had a Guard and Ticket Inspector for many years, the reason for this has been one of safety and general public well being. Many incidents and disputes happen on public transport and the public need someone to oversee this and someone to call upon for help.
Would you hold a major league football match with only one security guard?
Or an airplane with only the captain?
Then why do this to our trains? It is a security risk. Please ban the practice and help settle the dispute.

attributes.action: Anyone fly-tipping should lose their driving licence and have vehicle crushed
attributes.background: We live in a beautiful country and it's disgraceful to see people getting away with fly-tipping. Instead of fines if there is evidence from the public filming the offence then crush the offending vehicle and ensure the driver is banned from driving, and give them a community order to clear rubbish.

attributes.action: Review the current deportation system, and address its surrounding concerns.
attributes.background: Review gov. process of deportations, particularly through charter flights; address their impact on detainees. Address the impact of deportation centres, especially on children. Address lack of care for legal proceedings and claims before deportations. Address violence and racism on charter flights.
attributes.additional_details:
People subject to the UK deportation system are in a vulnerbale place, and there are many issues which need to be addressed.

I have written an article with references: http://writingco.tumblr.com/post/157272986629/secretive-night-flights-the-uks-un-reviewed 

Most powerful sources: http://www.medicaljustice.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/state-sponsored-cruelty.pdf & http://www.refugeecouncil.org.uk/what_we_do/childrens_services/working_with_age_disputed_children/children_in_detention
